Detailed Description

These operate on vectors as vectors, not component-wise.

Function Documentation

template<typename genType>
GLM_FUNC_QUALIFIER genType glm::reflect ( genType const &  I,
genType const &  N 
) [inline]

For the incident vector I and surface orientation N, returns the reflection direction : result = I - 2.0 * dot(N, I) * N.

Template Parameters:
genType Floating-point vector types.
See also:
GLSL reflect man page

template<typename T, precision P, template< typename, precision > class vecType>
GLM_FUNC_QUALIFIER vecType< T, P > glm::refract ( vecType< T, P > const &  I,
vecType< T, P > const &  N,
T const &  eta 
) [inline]

For the incident vector I and surface normal N, and the ratio of indices of refraction eta, return the refraction vector.

Template Parameters:
genType Floating-point vector types.
See also:
GLSL refract man page

GLSL 4.20.8 specification, section 8.5 Geometric Functions

Definition at line 323 of file func_geometric.inl.

References glm::dot(), and glm::sqrt().

00328         {
00329                 GLM_STATIC_ASSERT(std::numeric_limits<T>::is_iec559, "'refract' only accept floating-point inputs");
00330 
00331                 T dotValue = dot(N, I);
00332                 T k = T(1) - eta * eta * (T(1) - dotValue * dotValue);
00333                 if(k < T(0))
00334                         return vecType<T, P>(0);
00335                 else
00336                         return eta * I - (eta * dotValue + std::sqrt(k)) * N;
00337         }
